header.title: Shakeri et al. | Human-centered Digitalisation Consultancy

landing.title: A better future with technology is possible.
landing.subtitle: Through research, innovation, and education, Shakeri et al. ensures that technologies serve humanity and protect our planet.

hero.title: Hi, I am Dr Gözel Shakeri
hero.subtitle: I hold a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction and I have over 10 years of experience at the frontier of human-centered, sustainable digitalisation through my internationally award-winning research and communication skills. More

whatIdo.title: What I do
whatIdo.text1: I research the interaction between humans and technology, so you can make informed, strategic, and sustainable decisions towards your digital goals.
whatIdo.text2: I teach how technologies impact our behaviour and planet, so you can strengthen your digital skills and make smarter, more sustainable choices.
whatIdo.text3: I help you ideate, prototype, and test human-centered, sustainable solutions, so you can innovate creatively, collaboratively, and effectively.

waysIcanhelp.title: Ways I can help you
waysIcanhelp.text: Offering a range of services from needs-specific consultancy to workshops and trainings, I provide on-site support in the Eurometropole region and remote solutions for clients worldwide. My services are in English, German, and French.

research.title: Bringing Evidence to Decision-making
research.subtitle: Shakeri et al. delivers mixed-methods research and lends expertise across strategic intervention points.

researchbody.questionsanswers:
• What do current or desired users want, think, feel, and do?
  • What is their current experience of technologies or digital service?
  • Which research or experimental design is right for our goals?
  • Who else is doing something similar?
  • What's the best way to communicate research results so they drive impact?
researchbody.methodsanswers:
• Literature review & market analysis
  • Quantitative methods (numbers-driven insights): surveys & questionnaires, A/B testing, analytics and usage data, controlled experiments, benchmarking studies
  • Qualitative methods (deep human insights): interviews, focus groups, field studies / ethnography, usability testing, diary studies, Research-through-Design
  • Statistical analysis
researchbody.outcomesanswers:
• Reduce Risk: Spot design flaws early before they cost time and money.
  • Increase Adoption: Create products and services people actually want to use.
  • Boost Performance: Improve efficiency, conversion, and customer loyalty.
  • Stay Competitive: Leverage data and insights to outpace rivals.
researchbody.expertiseanswers: Holding a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction 🔗 from the University of Glasgow, my thesis was shortlisted for the Best Computing Science PhD in Scotland 🔗. I got recognised with an Outstanding Young Scientists 🔗 award for my research in sustainable Human-Computer Interaction. I published 13 conference and journal articles with 4 at the leading (A*) international conference in Human-Computer Interaction CHI.
researchbody.contact: Leverage research to answer your most pressing questions

education.title: Bringing Clarity to the Public
education.subtitle: Shakeri et al. clarifies society’s most urgent challenges with technology, which in turn empowers the public to act.
education.article: Technology is a near-constant presence in our lives, influencing our culture, our psychologies, and our environment. But the public often struggles to decipher the negative impact of technology as it is unfolding — or envision better paths forward with tech design. Shakeri et al. demystifies our current challenges with tech through technology and sustainability education.
education.whatanswers:
• Digital Literacy: Smart, safe, and effective use of technology.
  • Sustainability Literacy: Skills for sustainable living and working with real-world impact.
education.howanswers:
• Traditional Lectures: Clear delivery of core knowledge.
  • Futuring: Designing and prototyping future solutions.
  • Interactive Workshops: Hands-on, creative, and participatory.
education.whoanswers:
• Schools (ages 11-18): Inspiring, curriculum-linked programs.
  • Higher Education: Lectures and workshops at university level.
  • General Public: Accessible sessions via libraries, NGOs, and cultural centers.
education.outcomesanswers: • Future-Proof Skills: Learners will be equipped with digital and sustainability knowledge critical for tomorrow’s workforce and society.
education.resourcesanswers:
• Informative Flyer: English, French, German
  • Gözel's Fact Checker
  • Gözel's Science Engine
  • Gözel's Media Literacy Starter Kit
education.expertiseanswers: As an Outstanding Young Scientists 🔗 in Human–Computer Interaction, I have lectured on Sustainable Digitalisation, led Digital Media Literacy workshops, and excelled as an award-winning science communicator (both in speech and writing). As an experienced and certified educator 🔗, I am committed to continuous learning and staying at the forefront of emerging research and pedagogical innovation. More
education.contact: Navigate digitalisation and sustainability confidently and creatively

innovation.title: Big-picture Thinking & Practical Action
innovation.subtitle: Grounded in human-centered design, Shakeri et al. equips teams with tools and methods for creative collaboration and effective problem-solving, from co-design sessions to customized trainings.
innovation.whatanswers: Frame complex questions, define your goals, identify solutions, build rapid prototypes, and test and validate ideas with users in a multi-day design sprint.
innovation.howanswers: Be ready for digital and sustainable change by anticipating challenges, imagining opportunities, and designing resilient strategies for long-term success.
innovation.whoanswers: Topics for bespoke workshops have included effective team communication and re-assessment of team perfomance metrics.
innovation.outcomesanswers:
• Reduce Risk: Identify challenges and pain points early, avoiding costly missteps.
  • Increase Adoption: Design solutions that resonate, ensuring faster uptake.
  • Unlock Creativity: Co-create and collaborate to generate fresh, practical ideas.
  • Accelerate Innovation: Turn insights into actionable strategies and stay ahead.
innovation.resourcesanswers:
• About Human-centered Design
  • Human-centered Design Kit
  • Improv Games for Remote Design + Collaboration
  • Systemic Design Toolkit
  • New Metaphors
  • Design Think Make Break Repeat
  • AppHaus
  • Strategyzer
innovation.expertiseanswers: Recognised with an Outstanding Young Scientists Award 🔗 for creatively reshaping and redefining Sustainable Human-Computer Interaction, I have partnered with industry leaders (e.g., Tesco), government bodies (e.g., Food Standards Agency), and NGOs (e.g., WWF-UK) to drive tangible impact. As a certified 🔗 and experienced educator, I am dedicated to continuous learning and to integrating the latest research and pedagogical innovations to ensure my workshops and seminars are engaging, forward-looking, and effective. More
innovation.contact: Collaborate creatively and solve problems effectively

gozel.title: Dr Gözel Shakeri
gozel.text:
I am a human-centered innovator, researcher, and educator consulting on Sustainable Digitalisation and digital human behaviour. With a passion for solving complex challenges, I have reimagined how people interact with technology --- from transforming in-car experiences to enhancing collaboration in medical practices --- using proven design methods and practices.

Holding a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) 🔗 from the University of Glasgow, my thesis was shortlisted for the Best Computing Science PhD in Scotland 🔗.

Recognised with an Outstanding Young Scientists Award 🔗 for creatively reshaping and redefining the sustainable shopping experience, I have partnered with industry leaders (e.g., Tesco), government bodies (e.g., Food Standards Agency), and NGOs (e.g., WWF-UK) to drive tangible impact. My expertise has taken me to global platforms, including COP26 🔗, the UN Game Changers Lab 🔗, and the Global Conference for Safety Regulation and Sustainability 🔗, where I have led discussions on innovation and sustainability.

As an award-winning science communicator (both in speech and writing), a certified educator 🔗, and a certified manager 🔗, I have channeled my passion for human-centered design into teaching, serving as a university lecturer on human-centered innovation.

With numerous publications 🔗 and as a frequent speaker 🔗 at international conferences, I’m available for public speaking engagements to inspire and share insights on innovation and design.

'
gozel.teamtext: I have an extensive international network of experts I call on for engagements. My collaborators come from backgrounds in behaviour change, digital tech law, and design research.
gozel.subtitle1text: Start with humans, not policies, tools, or technologies.
gozel.subtitle2text: I believe that people do better work and are more creative when they are having fun.
gozel.subtitle3text: Teams are better when they work together, harnessing the diversity and complexity of the group.
gozel.subtitle4text: I foster a “yes, and” environment in which people accept and build on each others’ ideas.
gozel.experiencetext:
2025 -- now: Independent Sustainable Digitalisation Consultant: Research, Education, Innovation

2024 -- 2025: Sustainable Business Consultant: Management, Digital Transformation, Behaviour Change

2023 -- 2023: Research Fellow (equiv. to Junior Professorship): Sustainable Digitalization, University of Oldenburg

2021 -- 2022: Postdoctoral Researcher: Sustainability through Digital Behavior Change Interventions, University of Oldenburg

2019 -- 2021: Postdoctoral Researcher: AI Systems to Support People with Dementia, Univeristy of Glasgow
gozel.educationtext:
2015 -- 2019: Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction (Computer Science), University of Glasgow

2013 -- 2014: MSc of Computing Science, University of Glasgow

2009 -- 2013: BSc of Computer Science, Technical University RheinMain

hcd.title: Human-centered Design
hcd.abstract: My work is grounded in human-centered design — a creative problem-solving framework for leading and engaging with empathy and designing innovative solutions to complex problems.
hcd.whatanswers:
Human-centered design (ISO standard ISO 9241-210:2019), also referred to as design thinking, is a problem-solving process, by being predominantly solution-focused. It is comprised of robust methods and core mindsets that, when practiced together, allow people to collaborate, communicate, and work differently.

It involves discovering and understanding customer needs, defining and identifying opportunities, exploring and developing options, and delivering solutions by building and testing prototypes.
hcd.approach1answers: Using design thinking, I can help you transform your approach to problem-solving and innovation. This human-centered framework empowers businesses to craft impactful solutions while enabling professionals to become more adaptable, creative, and effective in their roles.
hcd.approach2answers: By combining qualitative and quantitative insights with rapid prototyping and testing, I uncover the full story — revealing deeper needs, motivations, and behaviors to drive smarter, more impactful decisions for your success.
hcd.approach3answers: By integrating evidence-based behavioral science frameworks such as the Behavior Change Wheel and Motive Disposition Theory, I craft strategies and solutions that inspire lasting change, deepen engagement, and strengthen resilience.
hcd.divider2: HCD is embedded in my approach to ...
